intro: Cynanchum eurystephanum, commonly known as the broad-stephanum milkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Asia, particularly China. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae, which includes other milkweeds known for their showy flowers and milky sap. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and riverbanks. Its leaves are lanceolate and often have a hairy texture, while its flowers are clustered in umbels and feature a distinctive corona. The plant is noted for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional Chinese medicine for various ailments.
